title: Design Thinking-based Science Problem-Solving Competency Enhancement Program

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational science knowledge and basic understanding of problem-solving processes
context.additional_context: Constructivist learning activities using digital devices, enabling inquiry and collaboration on complex science problems through individual/team project-based tasks.

learning_goals: Learners can systematically solve complex scientific problems by applying the five-stage design thinking process (Empathize-Define-Ideate-Prototype-Test).
Learners can derive solutions to ambiguous and overlapping problems that may occur in real scientific settings through iterative prototyping at least three times.
Learners can identify and apply improvement points in the problem-solving process with at least 80% accuracy through peer feedback and self-reflection.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
